page.title: 06TRAFFIC FREE CENTRE? HULL
page.content: As in most big cities the growth in the volume of{traffic}has caused major problems. Over 25,000 people are employed in Hull's{city centre}and the conflict between traffic and {pedestrians}has occupied the thoughts of the town planners for years. The old{'ring-roads'}are no longer adequate to divert heavy traffic and so now{'Orbital'}roads have been built north and south of the city centre. Thus greater{pedestrianisation}can proceed. Whitefriargate was paved in 1974 and similar works at the Pier and Market Place have now been completed. This is a continuing plan to produce a major{pedestrian area}from the Old Town, through the city centre to Ferensway. Redevelopment can then take place for the Marina, hotels and in particular, for attracting people to live in the centre of the town.
